https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

>>33448168

The 1st house in whole sign begins with the start of the constellation that the Ascendant is in, rather than at the ascendant itself. That's why I say that whole sign begins with the stars rather than something that I think has more bearing on the seasons (The horizon). I just don't think that the 4 seasons model even should be kept in the polar and tropical regions. A different model I think might suffice better, but what?

And yes, if one house system says one thing over another; they can't both be right. But if you give me one model and the format that it's in, I'll say how I would rule it. If it were in a different format, I would say how I rule it in accordance to that format.

Yes, people will get it wrong and I'm no exception. That's all part of learning. But it's also very important that people get the tools and the knowledge to be able to formulate their own conclusions and to back them up with their own knowledge and determination.

That's all that these threads are to me. A chance to give my takes on charts as they are presented to me and a place to demonstrate why I made the conclusions I did. My opinions on how the houses are oriented probably won't matter here in these threads. If it's not a format I'm familiar with, I won't work with it. It's not my place to try to correct them as to what the "correct way" is, or what is "more correct" than another. I'll just give my take and why I gave it like I did, and maybe if questioned I'll try and give more detail as to why I concluded it like I did. By saying one way is more correct than the other, you're just going to make people think that you're a troll and inviting shit-flinging, whether or not your way is actually the correct way.

threads.name: Tahoe Anon
threads.sub: Lake Tahoe General (LTG) Sharing stories about Lake Monsters and Mysteries
threads.com:
While Chase is offshore for work, I wanted to share some photos and stories from our Tahoe Explorations so far. I'll start off with this picture, which was given to us by a boat captain who has been working the lake 35 years.
>Clear day on Tahoe with water clear as glass
>Captain stops tourist boat for lunch
>Goes into cabin and hears screams from tourists
>Leans over the boat and sees this take off toward shore
>Pulls into shore shortly after
>Encounters terrified kayaking couple
>They share this picture they took of the same creature
>Some kind of large bulky fish
>Doesn't match any known species descriptions

The boat captain who told us this story is joining our team. He'll be introduced in a few weeks.

last_replies.name: Tahoe Anon
last_replies.com:
>>33448458
Captain said a fishing charter guide friend of his has a story related to s silver scaled creature.

>Charter guy out fishing for Mackinaw in one of his favorite spots
>Something takes off with his line
>Strips 300+ feet of line at wicked speed
>Finally charter guy tightens the drag and tries to bring this thing in
>Almost gets pulled off the boat
>Line goes slack and he falls backwards
>Spends an ungodly amount of time reeling in what he assumes is broken line
>When he reaches the end of his line it's intact
>A silver scale is hanging off a bent hook

He reckoned he'd snagged something on the side through its scales, rather than hooking its mouth.

last_replies.name: Tahoe Anon
last_replies.com:
>>33448458
Here is the captain's second creature story.

>Early in the morning in the Summer
>Running along a trail overlooking the lake
>Lake is calm and smooth like glass
>Notices a commotion about a mile out in the lake
>Stops to look
>No boats anywhere in sight
>A massive wake is moving across the Lake
>Starts to thrash and figure eight
>Captain watches perplexed for 2-3 minutes
>Wake disappears and lake is calm again

Perfectly calm day early in the morning. Not a boat in sight, no waves, and this happened in the deeper part of the lake.

last_replies.name: Tahoe Anon
last_replies.com:
>>33448486
Aside from corpses and monster legends, there are some very real mysteries in the lake. Some cool stuff has gone missing. Pic related is the true story of the Wells Fargo gold.

>Way back when there weren't really roads around Tahoe
>To get across people would take ferries or load cars onto barges
>Wells Fargo is sending payment over to loggers on the other side of the lake
>They load a small car with a chest of gold and supplies onto a barge
>They almost make it to the other side with no issues
>Something goes wrong when they are trying to transfer to the dock
>Car and chest of gold tumbles into the water
>Divers tried to find it in the spring but it rolled off an underwater cliff well over 90 feet deep somewhere
>Likely even deeper

We've narrowed down the spot it happened and once Chase's new tracked ROV is ready, that's what we'll be looking for first. After that, we'll look for two WWII era planes that crashed into each other way back when.

last_replies.name: Tahoe Anon
last_replies.com:
>>33448458
Years later the captain had the local native chief on his tour boat and told him his stories. The chief laughed and said this

>"There are fish in this lake that nobody has ever seen"
>Says they stay down deep and only come up when they feel like it
>There's plenty of food for them down there so why bother
>Says they've seen some crazy stuff and won't allow kids to play in water
>Says water babies come and take them

Anybody know the legends around "Water babies?" I'm interested to hear more.

last_replies.name: Tahoe Anon
last_replies.com:
>>33448449
Now let me get into the crazier stuff. Captain tells us about the politics of the lake. Tahoe is a haven for the wealthy. Some of the wealthiest people in the world have megamillion mansions and cottages there. It's also a big tourism hub. Anything that can threaten undue invasion of waterfront properties, or lake tourism, is frowned on.

>About a decade ago on a summer day in Tahoe
>Beach is packed with tourists
>Someone notices a strange brown and black mass floating on the shore line
>Ebbing back and forth with the waves like a jellyfish caught where beach meets waves
>It's alive whatever it is
>Black and jellylike, pulsating
>Some kind of little appendages or tentacles
>Mostly blob like and spherical
>Call the local environmental authorities (not a local so don't know for sure)
>they confiscate the blob
>When the person who found it called later they didn't know what they were talking about
>Never heard about it again

We have a deep sea video of a black blob creature that reminds me of this story. Don't know how similar they were, but its cool anyway.

Blob creature video: https://youtu.be/EhhrHV6-8Nc

In the morning of April 14, 1561, at daybreak, between 4 and 5 a.m., a dreadful apparition occurred on the sun, and then this was seen in Nuremberg in the city, before the gates and in the country – by many men and women. Likewise there stood on both sides and as a torus about the sun such blood-red ones and other balls in large number, about three in a line and four in a square, also some alone. In between these globes there were visible a few blood-red crosses, between which there were blood-red strips, becoming thicker to the rear and in the front malleable like the rods of reed-grass, which were intermingled, among them two big rods, one on the right, the other to the left, and within the small and big rods there were three, also four and more globes. These all started to fight among themselves, so that the globes, which were first in the sun, flew out to the ones standing on both sides, thereafter, the globes standing outside the sun, in the small and large rods, flew into the sun. And when the conflict in and again out of the sun was most intense, they became fatigued to such an extent that they all, as said above, fell from the sun down upon the earth 'as if they all burned' and they then wasted away on the earth with immense smoke. threads.com: What should I do if I am interested in practicing Tantra? I'm not into the supernatural side of it necessarily. Moreso for self-development & meditation.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
If you mean Buddhist Tantra, you have three choices of tradition, Tendai, Shingon and Tibetan Buddhism. Shingon and Tendai do not have guru devotion practices. You should first find a temple in one of those traditions that is legit. Of Tendai or Shingon you don't have many options and may have to attend a temple that streams services. They exist though. If you go the Tibetan route, No high control groups like New Kadampa, Shambala or traditions that are likely but not necessarily watered down stuff like Diamond Way.

Generally, you have to practice Mahayana Buddhist practices first. Both Tendai and Tibetan can be practiced solely as a Mahayana tradition. Shingon is solely Vajrayana. Here are some videos that can introduce you to each tradition. Each has a different way to go into Tantra. The Tibetan and Shingon traditions have classes in English. FPMT, Garchen Institute and North Seattle Koyasan respectively come to mind.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k0YRd0F8jRA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i3lJeC85THs

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vpLfDsVsOGE

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33447517
These are Hindu sources. It is important to note that there are different traditions of Hindu tantra that are aligned with different traditions. For example, Shakta and Shavist have different traditions. Kula for example is a type of tantra practiced by Shaktists. Each of these is associated with different Sampradaya. So within a single tradition like Shavism, you have different Sampradaya that have different positions on tantra, whether they accept it or which to practice.

I am very happy for this experience, whomever she was. I no longer feel the abject depression that I once had. I hope that I see her again soon, and, perhaps, I will meet her in real life, and she will be sympathetic with me as I try to climb back on to the razor's edge I was so stupid to fall off of.

I've had problems with pornography since the beginning of high school and by my mid 20s I was really bad off. The problem isn't completely under control now, but I am definitely much more conscious of it. Each person probably has their own reason for why they do it, but for me it seems to be a mental association with boredom and relaxation. When I'm by myself for the rest of the night and want to relax, thats one of the very first thoughts that pops in my mind. Now what if I were to change that association?
I've visualized my mental associations and drew them down as if they were divided like cubbies. It helps to be completely honest with yourself when studying these aspects. If I am to take 'masturbation' out of the cubbie of 'Relaxation', I need to put something it its place or else I'd be dealing with a void which is almost immediately apparent and will grow over time. Exercising might just be the thing that fills the void for me and I'm going to find out if that works.
For those of you who are dealing with similar problems like me, I hope this theory can help. It may seem dumb, but at least it makes sense to me.
